concise_definition: adj. 消失的, 不在的, 用完的; v. (go 的过去分词) 去过, 离开

definitions.explanation_en: No longer present or in existence; having disappeared, been removed, or ceased to be available.
definitions.explanation_cn: 不再存在或出现；已消失、被移除或耗尽。
definitions.example_en: The cookies are all gone — there isn't one left.
definitions.example_cn: 饼干全吃光了——一个都不剩了。

definitions.explanation_en: No longer in a particular place; having left or departed, often permanently or for an extended time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 不再处于某个地方；已离开，常指永久性或长时间的离去。
definitions.example_en: She's gone to Paris for the summer and won't be back until September.
definitions.example_cn: 她去巴黎过夏天了，要到九月才回来。

definitions.explanation_en: No longer functional, usable, or intact; having been consumed, damaged, or exhausted.
definitions.explanation_cn: 不再可用、功能丧失或完整；已被消耗、损坏或耗尽。
definitions.example_en: My phone battery is completely gone.
definitions.example_cn: 我的手机电池完全没电了。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to describe someone who has died, especially in a sudden or tragic way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于描述某人已去世，尤指突然或悲剧性地离世。
definitions.example_en: He was a great musician — now he's gone too soon.
definitions.example_cn: 他是一位伟大的音乐家——却过早地离开了人世。

definitions.explanation_en: The past participle of 'go'; used in perfect tenses to indicate movement away from a place or the completion of a journey.
definitions.explanation_cn: 动词 'go' 的过去分词，用于完成时态，表示离开某地或完成旅程。
definitions.example_en: I have gone to the store three times today.
definitions.example_cn: 我今天已经去过三次商店了。

comparison.analysis: “Lost” (丢失的) 强调因遗忘、遗失或无法找回而“失去”，常带有被动或遗憾的意味，如钥匙丢了、孩子走失。而 “gone” 更中性，仅表示“不在原处”，不一定是丢失，可能是主动离开或自然耗尽。
“Departed” (离开的) 是更正式、书面化的表达，常用于描述人离开或去世，语气庄重，如“departed soul”。而 “gone” 更口语化、通用，适用范围更广，包括物品耗尽、状态结束等。
“Finished” (完成的) 强调一个过程或任务的终结，如“finished work”或“finished meal”。而 “gone” 强调的是存在状态的消失，不一定是过程完成，如“the milk is gone”不等于“喝完了”，而是“没有了”。
